page.title: 12Stourton: a Dying Community
page.content: The{village}was once a close-knit, self-contained{community of about 2,500 people with its schools, library, park, chapels, church and shops, until it was demolished. The former Stourtoners held their reunion in{Stourton Liberal Working {Men's Club,}the last building in the village still in use. There was a nostalgic story to go with every drink. One of the favourites was about the day a fully-laden horse and cart disappeared into the local pond. It is still there to this day. Mr Peter Gregg, 39, said that the {demolition}of Stourton had "destroyed a community. The houses may have been bad, but there was a tremendous community spirit".
